message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
Iterator<Float> iterator = arrayList.iterator();
float spriteX;

if (iterator.hasNext()) {
    spriteX = iterator.next();
} else {
    iterator = arrayList.iterator(); // Reset the iterator if we're at the end
    spriteX = iterator.next();
}
<<<explanation>>>: This code creates an iterator from your ArrayList. It then checks if there is a next element in the list using iterator.hasNext(). If there is, it sets spriteX to the next element. If there isn't, it resets the iterator to the start of the list and sets spriteX to the first element. This will cycle through the ArrayList, going back to the start when it reaches the end.
